intro: Rhabdocaulon lavanduloides var. villosum, commonly known as the woolly lavender. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae, characterized by its aromatic, woolly-haired leaves and spikes of purple or blue flowers. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun. The plant's foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to attract pollinators.
